JggMVHVz65BKEcvGgSZ4gg.text: My wife and I ordered from here a few weeks ago and I was not very impressed.  It was not bad by any means, but it just seemed to be very average.  We ordered general tsos chicken, egg rolls, and sushi.  The sushi was the best part.  I had the Maki platter which was a spicy tuna roll, California roll, and a salmon roll.  The spicy tuna roll had a really good flavor.  The other two were also really good and fresh.  The egg rolls were not crisp and lacked any flavor.  The genera tsos was decent, but not anything I'd get again.  It also was not spicy at all despite their menu indicating it would be.

gTnVoXgcHBZHgYVeBvnjFw.text: Sad to give this place a low rating because really the food (of what I've tried) is good. The sushi especially really is delicious. Their spicy girl roll is one of my favorite rolls in pittsburgh. But my goodness the woman who works the front desk/phones is so Rude and disrespectful. She was the first person in my whole life and out of the hundreds of times I've eaten out/gotten takeout that I didn't tip. I was wondering layer of I was wrong to do that despite her horrible attitude when I heard my fellow coworkers all talking about her saying how they can't stand ordering form there anymore because of how nasty she is. So it seems to be a common theme. Really sad because again good food but I won't tolerate that kind of service.

yBAkcQ6IdYwhWSpi-y-lhw.text: Sushi was phenomenal. Fresh and tasty and the plating was bright and enticing. The curry on the other hand. Watery. Bland. Not that great. A little below average. I will definitely go here again for sushi but my hubby is SOL because he hates fish and he's mad and went to bed hungry because he said the curry sucked :(

lfHbnV2Su3Goi8MF65NCmA.text: Nah, this place is definitely not getting any future business from me.  We came in for all you can eat sushi that a coworker recommended to us.   I'm not trying to say that restaurants should not charge for waste for AYCE. But I think it is necessary to remind/mention for the waste charge. At the end, we have some left on the plate and they told us the waste charge is $1 for a piece left on the plate. Our waitress didn't mention anything about it even after she told us,"there is no chance that you guys will leave here hungry"! Take one star off from there. At the end, they charged us $15 for the leftover and let us to bring them home. We definitely overestimated ourselves but there comes to my second point. Old ingredients!  All the sashimi didn't taste fresh, tuna look brown! Shrimp were cut into slices(never had shrimp like that, it look like either pressed or just slice one shrimp into 2-3pieces shrimp), eel was old/over cooked and the best of all of them was salmon which is just like 5 out of 10 grade. Ordered some gyoza and they were fine, hard to mess up with that. It just they served it warm not hot. Make me wonder if they microwaved it then fry it for a minute. I've made gyoza at home or other restaurants and I remember them being a little bit warmer than that. Fried dumplings, my husband spit it out after one bite!   Sushi! Here is the what came here for. They are not bad I have to admit. But not outstanding either. Looking at how old are their sashimi, it's hard to make me believe that the sushi are fresh.   At the end, I understand they want to close on time so everybody who work there can go home. But, is it really necessary to clean to floor by our table while we are still eating? Ah, I forgot to mention the beer was flat as well.   Overall, like I said in the beginning, not going back. But if someone is hungry for sushi, I guess it is not a bad deal to go there to eat sushi only. But there are so many places where you can spend $30 and have 2 rolls that is fresh and tasty.

QPZ0WvqNoz-IEuJKdqJ4ow.text: I'll be honest, I was a little skeptical about the 3.5 star rating until I read the poor reviews- most of them were the result of the delivery service.  Now, this review is rather on the dine in service, specifically the AYCE option Sunday-Thursday.  We came in around 5:20, it was a ghost town. A row of takeout orders were laid out on the sushi bar, but we sat in a booth.  The servers were attentive, obviously with nothing to do, glanced at us from the distance. This worked out very nicely so that we could order everything in a paced manner rather than flagging down a running server.   So, we placed our order, and thus began the AYCE feast. It took maybe 20 minutes or so from when we walked in to the time we got our first round, they forgot some things, which turned out to just be on another plate that would come later. They did, however, forget the spicy tuna nigiri I had ordered, but honestly finishing most of everything was difficult for me- the person I was with was not that hungry that day and I refuse to be a victim of leftover fees!  We had six rolls and sashimi. For AYCE, this place stands out because they offer sashimi. The downside? Small, thin, sashimi. At the same time, you can order more so it's not a big deal. Just got to be wary for the next time.   The salmon and eel were phenomenal. Albacore and white tuns were not noteworthy  We had the:  Tiger roll-amazing, the mango sauce really complemented the lobster    godzilla roll x2- perfect temperature and texture. Best whole fried roll Ive had from anywhere, even SoCal  dynamite roll- Perfect temperature and texture, also really good, but godzilla had a better compilation of flavor  2 in 1 roll- very nice  fire island roll- a favorite, the tempura flakes in both the spicy tuna and spicy lobster were amazing  terrific roll- really nice! The sauce on the top was neat.

photos.caption: Photo of Katana - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tiger roll, 2 in 1 roll, Godzilla, dynamite, sashimi in the back
Photo of Katana - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Godzilla and terrific roll
Photo of Katana - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fire island roll and eel sashimi

Kd538w1Tu7T4u2cHz7lCow.text: I've only done delivery from here, but they're always fast and the food is consistent and decent. The only criticism would be that their Pad Thai is a weird color but it hasn't stopped me from ordering yet!

ZiH354iD3rarahPIzQFIAA.text: My boyfriend and I decided to stay in on a Friday and order take out from Katana. We ordered over $40 worth and it was all amazing! My favorite was the chicken lo mein and crab ragoon. Everything was delicious, arrived on time and hot! Thank you! We will be ordering again.

p4EG1EiTX8jzOSDfmGJXKQ.text: Ordered food to be delivered via Yelp app. I requested white rice instead of fried but did not receive it. I also asked for extra shrimp sauce instead of steak sauce. However, I did not receive either the steak or shrimp sauce. Also, there was no dressing for my side salad. Total disappointment after waiting an hour for it to be delivered. Will not be going back.

OGhTgzugznTXMpn8eh_wAg.text: So it was my birthday and my friend and I decided to come here on a whim. It was around 1pm when we rolled up. We walked in and no one else was there. It was completely empty. We sat at the bar and looked over the menu. They had a lunch special for around $15 for an assortment of fish plus a roll based on the chef's pick. I wasn't sure if I wanted the fish picked for me, but my friend clarified with the waitress it wasn't going to be anything crazy. It was more along the lines of salmon and tuna, which we could totally roll with (get it..roll..ha..).  We both ended up with the lunch special and it turned out really, really good. The plate came with two pieces of salmon, two pieces of tuna, and two pieces of another fish. I think it may have been yellowtail though I'm not completely sure. Then it had three pieces of nigiri sushi with one salmon, one tuna, and one possibly yellowtail. There was a six piece crunchy type roll that tasted really good. It was definitely filling and amazing. I was really pleased with the quality of fish and the price for it all. Of course our waitress was sweet and attentive. I would hope so if we're the only customers. I did run to the bathroom to wash my hands and it was clean, which is always a plus. I would definitely come back to get more of my fish fix.

photos.caption: Photo of Katana - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chefs choice lunch special. Bomb!

gUyLA_akwXp6CpOBmb5J3g.text: As a sushi fanatic, how could I say no to all-you-can-eat sushi! For $23.95, it's a bit pricey (depending on how much sushi you can handle), but I was going in for the challenge. You start by selecting what items you want off their all-you-can-eat menu which does not include everything off their regular menu, but it was still a decent selection nonetheless. There are also appetizers included like vegetable gyoza, noodles, edamame, etc. Although they have specific rolls they offer, they were open to my different customization requests which was great. The sushi served was of good quality and came out pretty quickly after we submitted our order. My favorite was the sweet potato tempura roll. SO GOOD! The overall experience was great, except for the fact that our waitress would disappear for long periods of time. Probably a sign that she wanted us to stop eating all their sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of Katana - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Inari, Tamago, and avocado/cucumber/cream cheese roll
Photo of Katana - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sweet potato tempura roll in the back, 2 mystery rolls that were not mine, tamago (egg) and Inari

ElPoTJTi5sSW6FlgPY4c9w.text: Great food and prices. Really enjoy the sushi.  Always a good experience. Try the Eggplant , it is awesome.

g_TT-Io9gUAqrMaHfEyLBg.text: Great food! Went with some friends for lunch and we got the all you can eat sushi and it was amazing! Ordered some classic sushi rolls as well as specialty roles and they were also amazing! Even the side salad was good, I think they home make their ginger dressing! From Austin and wasn't expecting much, but I will return next time I find myself in Pittsburg, it was amazing! Great service and giant restaurant!

qg2OTTfcOmenDgMPRcpmPg.text: I was not a fan of Katana. My husband & I had a Groupon for Katana so we thought we would give them a try. First off the menu is WAY too large. It's like 8 pages or so, then they have about 12 additional specials listed on the table PLUS more specials listed on the blackboard on the wall. Too many options, it's overwhelming..stick to one style of food and master that style.  I could pretty much tell the food was going to be so so from the appetizer. We ordered the vegetable spring rolls. Very basic & the dipping sauce was not so great. Bland & not much flavor.  My husband & I ordered a bunch of different sushi pieces to split. We tried about 6 different ones & none of them stood out. Pretty basic, none of them had a flavor that popped.  Our waitress was nice & helpful when we had questions.  I would not go back too many other way better sushi places in Pittsburgh to go to.

photos.caption: Photo of Katana - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Katana - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vegetable spring roll

V1sYqsinFT7ePpLYd-i9Tg.text: This place is the worst.   1) went in with three people to grab food to go and asked to have the check split. The guy could have just said no, but he said he could do it. Turns out as we're leaving a female Working said he did the math in his head.... Well, he completely over charged all of us. Not cool.   2) ordered delivery once. Called after and hour and half to inquire as we're five minutes away and it was a Sunday. Female said they are busy and it will get there after initially being quoted 45 minutes. Rude  3) got someone else's sushi in takeout. Called to advise and they said just eat it. That's cool and all but they should have asked what it was so they could call who they shorted   We're done with Katana. Less than average food with terrible service.

TdORovjVL2KV7_pipqNlng.text: Please go before this gem shuts down!!!!  There are only 4 reviews so far and they are all good - and rightfully so.  Come on people!  This place is awesome and needs some support in Dormont!  My husband and I went here after trying to get drinks at Cain's - which I love, but for some reason, no one would serve us.  So we headed over to Asian heaven aka Katana.  It's very pretty inside - not what you are expecting on this end of West Liberty.  They sat us in the front window near the tables for hibachi, but far enough way that the roaring cooking noises would be distracting.  We decided to get both hibachi and sushi to try it out - and we are so glad we did!  J had the special dragon roll - spicy tuna inside, lobster salad and jalepeno outside.  He also got the phoenix roll which was awesome.  I had the shrimp and scallop hibachi.  First comes the typical, but always awesome salad with ginger dressing and the bowl of miso soup.  Then comes a massive plate heaped with giant scallops, huge shrimp, more crunchy vegetables than I could handle and delicious fried rice.  The sauces were excellent and a bit different than I have had other places.    When they bring your check, they also bring some fruit sliced up which is a nice addition to the bill.   All in all - some of the best sushi in the city and some delicious hibachi make this a worthwhile place to try - and help out.  Keep Katana open and stop by :)

rx3ixJ4FfCFKTyobZyhTmQ.text: Just orderd delivery from Katana, which was my first time having their food.   The udon noodles are delicious - maybe the best in town, definitely the best in the south hills. Decent tofu and veggies. Love that you can get brown rice, and love love love the online ordering option. Very affordable,too!

wdV8ZBUCIGD7VCAAiFbLEA.text: I've been a weekly regular since they opened years ago and have never had a problem with delivery till tonight. For whatever reason this weekend, their excuse was that they decided to do all you can eat sushi (which is usually just a Sunday through Thursday thing) and they didn't anticipate a crowd?  It's Saturday night!  It's always busy!  So the results were it took over an hour and a half to get our food when it usually takes 20 min and when it finally arrived, they forgot half of the sushi order!  I've been to other excellent sushi places where they will put as many chefs behind the sushi counter as necessary to keep up with demand... But not with katana.  I've had dine in issues before at katana where they are slammed on a Wednesday and only have one guy to do all the sushi.  Now it's affecting the weekend orders as well?  Completely unacceptable for as place open as long as they have and really makes me feel like they are choosing profits over customer satisfaction.  If you are going to offer all you can eat sushi for dine in, open up that pocket book and HIRE some more chefs!

zc9Hk2bwkAvgZAC7efJRUA.text: It seems like there have been so many Chinese and Japanese restaurants popping up all over the place.  Well they can stop popping up because everyone needs to start coming to Katana instead!  We've had take out from here a few times and it was always tasty so we decided to head there for our Friday night get out.  Delicious!  I had a spider roll and the shrimp and scallops.  The portions were very generous compared to some of the other hibachi places I've been.  We will definitely be back!  Give it a try, I'm sure you won't regret it.

z1oCXeKhphrXRQAoMI9VQw.text: I've been here three times now. Once for Hibachi and the other two for sushi. I'm a big fan of their Hibachi.  Now I get that Hibachi uses butter, but I also don't like my Hibachi so greasy that I have a gut ache when I get home. Katana delivers. It was delicious and I didn't feel like I consumed a gallon of butter after wards. The sushi is also delicious. Both time that I've ordered it has been fantastic. Here's my beef. They advertise their All-You-Can-Eat sushi nights. We went on one occasion, and my friend being a huge fun a sushi ordered. They have these silly rules that you have to finish everything on your plate if you order all-you-can-eat or they surcharge you. Why? I don't understand why we could have taken a few pieces home. Also, our waiter literally stood across the room and stared at us to watch friend finish his second plate of sushi. That was super irritating. I don't like to be stared down while I eat.  Other than that I have not experienced issues with the service. It's fast and friendly. I will definitely be back to Katana, but not for all-you-can-eat sushi. I don't enjoy being the staff's show.

2hL4s1U2vV32rc4BaOe_nQ.text: Best sushi in the Burgh and they deliver!  Volcano and Godzilla rolls area the best. Also, try the spring rolls. Wowzer!

k2zaB1h3k87MdCBGg-1TnA.text: Went in for the 'all you can eat sushi'.... More like all you can eat RICE.  If you are a sushi fan don't waste your time. The fish quality was below average to poor. The portion size for sushi was a fist size chunk of rice and a piece of meat so thin the chef may have used a razor blade. Would not recommend for the 'all you can eat' deal.

bwLWBvsAC7bt0tnPHS0WXw.text: I have been here three times now, and all I have is good things to stay. I have had the sushi on two of my trips and both times it was fresh, tasty, and presented nicely. On my most recent visit I ordered off of the regular menu and had Szechuan shrimp. It was good and had the right amount of spice to it. The steamed dumplings and pork egg roll were both excellent as well.

KIShxw2e2knEftwqSU90xw.text: You MUST get the Crispy Duck. It will make your companion or date drooollllll!!! The sushi, tuna tartare, and the dessert were amazing as well. Great addition to Dormont.

H1Tdu5zi_gRdF-cciOsgNw.text: This place is super awesome! The sushi is FANTASTIC...especially the spicy crunchy tuna roll! Their other cuisine is also yummy...including the chicken lo mein, crab rangoon, edamame, and egg rolls. Im def a repeat customer...good thing its within walking distance!

IIXJOHnNYO6k4Mhwd61cbA.text: We used a groupon to check this place out. Despite having a pleasant sever, the service was poor. We ordered the dumplings (delicious), spring roll (not tasty at all. Probably the worst i have ever had), and chicken and steak hibachi (very salty). I can't say I will be back any time soon. It was just okay for us.

ynpFOnAo4niT4gjY3TOd3g.text: Chinese food is really gross.  Sushi is at times pretty good.  Mostly just passable.   Rude people who act like your bothering them the second you call/walk in.  Plenty of better places nearby.

jYNcHA1BbbgkiiInYWtQ8A.text: Best Japanese in Pittsburgh and I have been to them all. Great sushi and awesome filet and chicken hibachi combo. If your into it, try the Kim chi , very good flavor if you like that sort of thing. Absolutely delicious Saki.

Lxg6W_FeMP0tYfJPonn7zQ.text: My husband and I went here for lunch today (Saturday) and had a really good experience. The place was empty but they had only been open for an hour. We got the beef negimaki and it was awesome! We eat got sushi for lunch, rolls and nigiri and everything tasted fresh and delicious. It was a little pricey for lunch ($48 with tip) but we will definitely be back again.

R2NRtoODObFBcKGqXkraJA.text: Food was great. Service was awesome.  Even the desserts were delicious.

J-F_uLFkDI-gGS6-vobPrA.text: I came to Katana for the first time last Friday, January 2nd.  There were 4 people in my party. We made a reservation for the Hibachi. We were seated immediately. Our waitress came over and got our drink orders and came back with them fairly promptly. Next, she took our food orders. I personally don't like hibachi so I wanted to order Basil Noodles. I was informed that those weren't available so I ordered Lo Mein instead. The salads were brought out quickly by another member of your wait staff. This waitress was asked by multiple people for refills and chopsticks since our waitress had disappeared. Our chef, Clint, was AWESOME! Very funny guy. Very talkative. And the 3 other people in my group that got hibachi were very happy with their meals. During the "hibachi show" put on by Clint, our waitress came back to the table to check drinks for 5 of the other patrons at our table and one member of our group but never the 3 remaining. Not once did she try to offer us another beverage or just check to make sure we were ok(and we were the only people at the table having alcoholic beverages)! The hibachi show finished and most people at the table were nearly done with their meals and my lo mein had yet to be seen. Clint was concerned and tried to ask the girl that was at the front counter about it but she offered no assistance. Finally our waitress came over and I had to motion her over to me as she was ignoring me! She said, Oh! Your food will be done soon! And then she go away from us as quick as possible. Did she go check on my food in the kitchen? Nope! To add insult to injury, she went to the hibachi table next to us to check on their drinks. Another 10 minutes go by and everyone is done with their food and mine finally comes out. When she puts the food down and 3 of us asked for more drinks since we finally had her. She came back over with our drinks. I ate BY MYSELF. Then asked for our bill. I HAD TO SAY SOMETHING ABOUT OUR SERVICE. I am NOT one of THOSE people. But, it was just not acceptable. She said, sorry after she listed a bunch of excuses as to why my food took so long.  And I said ok, but you never checked on our drinks.  She offered to take $5 off the bill. I would have expected a little more than that.  Overall, the food was good but the service was seriously disappointing!   I would give 4 Stars to the food and the Chef, Clint.  But the overall service was TERRIBLE.

6GNIVJCqvvPAKXKL3oa9Sg.text: I gave this place 2 chances. i love japanese food and really wanted to love this place because it is close to home. I was underwhelmed the first time and disgusted the second time. the food was tasteless and not what the menu stated. Soba noodles are not white, they are buckwheat and are beige at the lightest and brown at the darkest. When I called (i had delivery) to tell them that I did not get what I ordered, I was told that it was correct and I was wrong. Food was tasteless and service was Awful. Do not waste your money or your time.

T7mQZTWn3L5DnjLYlc_4BQ.text: Food was great, but with 4 people and a $98 bill they would not accept the groupon the night it was expiring, because one other person got the Sushi special for $23.95.  $23.95 is not a cheap special, and with 2 - $10 corking fees on 2 bottles of wine they said they are loosing money.  Completely disappointed since they averaged $25 per person and basically wasted the groupon. ---Not customer friendly at all, but they had great food.  :-) :-(

LTRgG9qFxknjLWXeXEk2GA.text: Creative rolls, high quality & reasonable prices.  Ambiance needs some work.  If I remember correctly they were playing country music.... and there wasn't much charm.  Maybe dim the lights and play something more upbeat and innocuous... electronica?

R1UJ1sMPkDgh8aFGUaeQzQ.text: I picked one star because there was no option for 0 stars... This is the worst customer service in a sushi bar that we have ever experienced in the entire city..  For 30 minutes drinks 1 hour sushi wrong orders terrible service check out this spot

SWCmDwlGP7DXTaLSyGREhA.text: My friend and I tried katana and didn't care for it. The service and food were average. The Singapore noodles were the worst I have ever had. The sushi was better but nothing exceptional.

skSN1LvZSEKi4TLspksvgA.text: I ordered three sushi rolls for delivery. After a 45 minute wait, I received the delivery and noticed that the order looked incorrect. Instead of three rolls, I received two trays of sushi that looked extremely similar, instead of the three different sushi rolls that I ordered.  I asked the delivery person about this error. The delivery man said that he was unaware of what happened, but would ask at the restaurant and let me know.  I waited long enough for Katana to call and explain, but did not receive a response.  I called the restaurant and explained my concerns. The employee on the phone was aware of the situation, and said that the sushi only looked similar, but was in fact different.  When I read the description of the sushi from the menu, which clearly outlined the significant difference in each of the three sushi types I ordered, the employee said that the chef "must have forgotten" to put some of the vegetables on the sushi.  I asked if in the future I would need to specify exacly what I would like on each roll, to which she said, "Yes, sometimes people do not like cucumbers."  Not once did the employee apologize for this error, let alone offer the delivery person to send the correct order or provide me a refund.  The sushi that was delivered tasted old, leading me to believe that the restaurant simply wanted to get rid of their inventory before the close of business.  I am very unhappy with not only the food product, but the horrible customer service as well.  I would not recommend ordering delivery from this restaurant.

eMaEh8mnMFOLWI8RF5tF0g.text: Went this week for sushi and dinner. Loved the menu and that they offer Asian varieties (Japanese, Chinese, and Thai). Our hibachi chef was funny and very kind. He came to make just one meal for our table of 4; everyone else got meals that weren't hibachi. Great sized portions and very reasonable prices.

AWpKcbvh2imHLEJLJH8ZjA.text: Best Hibachi chef we have ever had. Hidden gem in Dormont.  Food and service was excellent.  We will definitely be back.

Fek4uFYb2UIA3PsLg6ARFA.text: I've been here numerous times and loved it every time. Great service and delicious food. I should add that I've only ever had their hibachi (filet mignon, shrimp, chicken, and steak) and sushi. The cooks have the typical corny hibachi jokes, but that's to be expected. They're on Groupon a lot, so I would definitely recommend buying one and treating yourself. Great little place to eat right in Dormont. Parking may be difficult depending on the time and day you go. Also, they offer all you can eat sushi nights. Enjoy and don't forget the groupon!

lxVJ1oPCxZ-9zWuIF-gDGg.text: In walking distance to my castle, and I love a good sushi.  The sushi was average at best.  I would go back to try the hot menu, but not just for sushi.  It was a random Thursday night around 7PM and it was pleasantly not crowded but the service confused and the atmosphere was just disoriented.

UODb27_89n8JPzwHLCIg5w.text: One of my favorite Asian cuisine places in Dormont. Bento boxes, sushi, tempura, lo mein, mu shu, hot and sour soup - so many great options. I was skeptical at first because of so many different styles under the same roof but they have been excellent every time! I don't live far but they deliver with the quickness, like really fast most of the time. Can't say enough how awesome their bento boxes are

zeOwn78YPEh083IDOzcgLQ.text: Just ordered a rainbow roll and it was terrible. No taste at all. The shrimp hibachi was average. $28 for terrible sushi and average hibachi.. Never again!

T-MIayuNjxR5hHze4XESgg.text: I must have eaten here a dozen times in the past month or so, and every time I leave stuffed and satisfied. Service and food are consistent. I've come across some new favorites on the menu in addition to the Thai curries and the 7 Star Around the Moon - namely the chicken/beef and eggplant in garlic sauce - has some nice heat to it that works great on cold days like today.   Still haven't tackled the sushi, but this place is consistently a winner. My only fear is the place always seems to be empty. Makes for a nice atmosphere but I want this place to do well so it sticks around - get out there and try it people!

U4I_249xdSKbTrpAxY5tQA.text: My mom and I have been here twice - once with a groupon and once for the unlimited sushi deal.  The service both times was seriously lacking.  There were only 4 parties in the restuarant and two waitresses servicing the area and it still took them 15 minutes to approach our table for drinks.  Then, when we wanted to order additional items from the unlimited sushi menu, the waitress got our orders wrong (which we wrote down) and forgotto bring us spicy mayo (also wrote down).  When I asked again for the spicy mayo, it took ten minutes for her to bring it out to me, at which point I was already done.  The sushi itself was pretty standard, and a bit dry.  It had a good sushi to rice ratio, but the flavors weren't there and we won't be back - regardless of the great pricing for unlimited sushi.

nzJKtSSihN9KQUs5WErKcQ.text: Would definitely eat here again.  There is something on the menu for everyone - hibachi, thai, sushi, etc.  The sushi was very good, price is very competitive with Little Tokyo just up the road, though could be considered a tad on the pricey side when compared to Sushi Kim in the Strip District.  Delicious food though, can't wait to go again!

qBa2ayta3OQHq47Cu1GBfg.text: LOVE their sushi. They're delivery is also very fast. I usually order their Lo Mein and a sushi roll when I get delivery. I ordered their Hibachi for delivery a couple times and am always slightly disappointed because my vegetables and meat are usually in water? Literal water. I am never disappointed when eating it there though. Everyone is so nice and the food is always so good!

yBvbmj0uQPuNJ8Psg384gA.text: I've been here a few times. The sushi and service are always pretty good. The spicy special rolls are among the best in the city.

ZXnZ26rn0UOhh7GDxLHRgw.text: One of my favorite Asian restaurants in the Area. Never crowded to dine it and take out is always delivered really quickly. Sushi is always fresh and the Chinese food is very tasty. The hibachi is a good show but the take our meal might be better.

CnuqbKgmkOYciTzgFK3Bzg.text: the waitress recommended an entree named "seven stars and moon" under Chef's signature section , which is merely a mixture of different meat, tastes awful! the sesame shrimp also very bad!!! even not fully cooked!! and the service is the poorest i've ever seen.

UKgBxjV718lI6NTckNNNyQ.text: Quiet little place we go to any time we are craving late night hibachi. They hours are really convenient as is the location. We worry that they aren't busy but it is great for getting a quick table. I think that we like it so much because of it's convenience but there food is very good.  Everything we have had here is great, sushi, hibachi and appetizers. Their hibachi chicken is really great and the portion sizes are generous.

-N7ILuC37D6m2yXYyFxZSw.text: I have been to Katana quite a few times. I really like the food and the service has always been good. Every time I've been there we sat at the hibachi table, but I like that they offer other asian varieties of food so everyone can find something they like. My new favorite thing about this place is that they deliver to my house. This is my go to place for ordering Chinese food. You can even get the hibachi menu  items delivered. Delivery is timely and the food is always good. I will continue to get delivery from Katana.  The online ordering is also a plus!

wZzfShRqZBLzB7sETBlxWw.text: Not very good, I'm shocked that this place had so many stars.  We recently moved to the area and are looking for amazing sushi, this wasn't it.

42EpdrgrVdXGPxBTppPytw.text: Pretty good chirashi. Salmon was extra fresh. Good portion size fish. Miso soup was a little watered down but overall, solid 4.456 stars :-o
